headline: Spinach and Potato Frittata
description: This tasty potato frittata is loaded with creamy reds, fresh spinach, garlic, green onions, and cheese for a scrumptious brunch or breakfast dish.

video.description: Thinly sliced red potatoes line the bottom of a cast iron pan.
video.name: Spinach and Potato Frittata

name: Spinach and Potato Frittata

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook potatoes in hot oil, stirring occasionally, until tender but firm, about 10 minutes. Mix in spinach, green onions, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until spinach is wilted, 1 to 2 minutes.
Beat together eggs and milk in a medium bowl. Pour over vegetables in the skillet. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until eggs are firm, 5 to 7 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is a good basic recipe to add whatever makes your mouth happy. I had some leftover bacon (whoever has leftover bacon??) so I added that along with a red bell pepper. It was very yummy. It will be a routine Thursday night breakfast for dinner!

I give it 4 because it's an omelette if cooked on a stove top, not what I would call a frittata. Other than that, its tasty - I would add some bits of a blue soft cheese such as a cambazola would add an extra dimension. Great clear easy recipe to follow though üëç
I cooked the onions and peppers in mine before adding the potatoes
Love this recipe! So easy to make & it is delicious anytime. Even someone as cooking challenged as I can handle it. Thank you for putting some variety in my recipe arsenal.
very good, I did add mushrooms otherwise made as written
Added sun-dried tomatoes and baked it may 400 for 20 min. It was delicious.
Nice & simple. I tweaked it a little since my husband can't have ANY spice. Omitted the onion, added some proscuitto with a bit of oregano. It was really good.

Easy & tasty. Seasoned potatoes with Parmesan, salt, paprika, pepper mix. Did all in cast iron pan, so after cooking covered on stove top, able to put in oven for eggs to set for final minutes Served with sausage....great wknd meal!
Simple and flexible recipe ... a great "breakfast for dinner" option - especially served with some salsa. :) (Bonus was having enough leftovers for breakfast the next day.)
There was a little too much cheese, and with all of the moisture coming from the cover, it got a little soggy, but it was delicios!

It tastes really great, however cooking the egg and getting it fully cooked on the top was extremely difficult. Me and my boyfriend had to flip it because the bottom was getting so brown and I didn‚Äôt want it to burn
Loved the recipe. Very easy to follow. I finished cooking in the oven. Next time I make it I plan added some more spices to kick it up a notch.
Tripled the spinach and finished in a 375 degree oven.

I only used three small potatoes and it was plenty. Added more spinach too, but those were the only real changes I made. In my opinion, potato just doesn't work well (flavor and texture) in the frittata.

I was looking for something hearty and quick for breakfast and I wanted to make something from what I had on hand. This was perfect! I added some chopped up turkey sausage patties to make a one dish meal for the family but I would have been happy with it either way. Great served with salsa!

I went with what I had. Added a sweet potatoe and started with fried onion. Added flavour- I roasted potatoes for 25 mins at 425 to up the flavour too. Plus had some cherry tomatoes so threw them in. Was great! Would do it again. Tip- wasn't quite done at recommended time so did a few mins on broil in oven.

I added seasonings to the potatoes as many recommended, doubled the spinach, and finished it in the oven as many recommended. The potatoes were still not done (I did not know what "tender but firm" meant, clearly.)

Searched it up to use an abundance of spinach we had on hand. Probably won't make it again.

The leftovers were better with adding sharp cheddar and green taco sauce.

This recipe is an excellent base but I do agree with other reviews. It needs to be seasoned a little more aggressively. I had leftover roasted red potatoes in the fridge so I sliced those and put a light golden brown on them with bacon fat. I added 1/4 of an onion, saut√©ed, and doubled the spinach. I layered with white cheddar and seasoned each layer with garlic and seasoned salt and additional black pepper. Topped with sour cream and served with a toasted baguette. I did stove-top it until semi-set and finished in the oven at 400 degrees F for about 6 minutes. Broiled for an additional minute. Will keep this recipe handy.
Made just as instructed. Amazing, next time I made it I added some fresh sliced Cremini mushrooms. Definitely a keeper !
I would end it in the oven to cook the top, otherwise overdone and dry.
This was so good! My family loved it I will be making this again for sure

This recipe is very good. Makes for a good lunch or dinner. You can use yukon gold potatoes and the recipe will come out perfect. I love to always have an option to use up my veggies especially spinach. Try it with some crusty bread on the side. Will make it again!

Excellent breakfast or dinner entree! Lighter than we anticipated. We used baby spinach because that was what we already had on hand, and did not get much of a spinach taste. Next time we will use regular spinach. Might try mushrooms, as well...
Very good flavor. It took a long time for the eggs to cook, so I put it in the oven to finish it up.

This is a good vegetarian dish. I made it exactly as printed and it was enjoyed by both my son and me. One of my family members does not like spinach (imagine that!) so I'll make it with cooked broccoli and maybe add sliced mushrooms, too. An egg or two extra may be required. I think I'll make it again soon.
Totally delicious. Easy to make. Liked that it was cooked on top of the stove instead of being baked in the oven.

Good Base recipe. As another reviewer stated, if you don't season the potatoes while they cook, they come out bland. I seasoned with garlic powder, turmeric, nutmeg and black/white and red pepper. Added bacon and allowed pototoes to cook in bacon fat. Only used two Idaho potatoes instead of six. I cooked it on the stove in a cast iron skillet till the edges turned lighter, then put into a stove at 425 degrees for ten minutes. Delicious!

I just made this for dinner because I forgot to take anything out of the freezer. I did make some substitutions and used this as a base recipe. I didn't have red potatoes so I substituted russet and my green onions had gone to God, so I used sliced sweet onions. I had cheddar cheese, but I figured I'd try goat cheese with sun dried tomatoes. WOW! My husband cleaned his plate and is looking forward to leftovers for breakfast.
It's easy to prepare and a favorite for brunch at home. I didn't change a thing.

It was my first time making a frittata. I burned the potatoes due to my own negligence but was still pretty good. I did use a large skillet instead of a medium after reading some of the comments on this recipe; I think medium would have been better.

Made once as is. Bland and too basic. Made 5 star offerings many times since. SEASON those potatoes and use your imagination for the mix-ins. I have added smoked salmon with spinach and dill..delish !!! Once used crabmeat I had bought to make another dish, a dip that did not get made....also delish. OF COURSE any veg almost will work as well as ham, chicken or leftover roast meats if you want it as a full meal to please most men.
Family pleaser.
Very tasty! Made for my mom's birthday brunch. Everybody loved it. Everybody wanted to dig in so fast that I forgot to take a picture :)

The only reason I did not give this 5 stars was because the recipe, as written, needed modifications. As other reviewers pointed out, the potatoes were very bland, to combat this, I used some restaurant seasoning from a local burger place. This is an awesome vegetarian dish, but I live in a house of carnivores so we had to add meat. I added some deli ham and some cooked, chopped bacon just before adding the spinach. The 4 star review was from the as written recipe, the slight modification of seasoning on the potatoes made it a 5 star dish. The addition of meat made it a dish my family wants again.
Easy to make. A little bland but fine with a dash of hot sauce on top.
I fried some bacon and crumbled it and added it to the potato‚Äôs. I also finished it in a 375 degree oven to get the top browned.
I added ground beef to half of it and that side was even better.
Good recipe, but needed at least double the cooking time and a little bland. More add-ins ( green peppers, etc.) would help.

Required a large skillet. For a regular pan, use more oil then indicated and stir potatoes for even cooking and so they don't stick. Could also use more spinach and more cheese. Found that it took more time to cook than noted, and had to also put it under the broiler for a couple of minutes to finish.
Add herbs and/or spices for more flavor and serve with Sriracha if you like it extra spicy!
Thanks again I hope did I call
Added some crumbled bacon, red & yellow peppers and seasoned the potatoes with rosemary and a pinch of dill. Very tasty!

My Grandmother and 97 year old Mom always made this dish on Fridays when we couldn't have meat. I use this recipe and throw in whatever I happen to have in the house in the way of vegetables and always add a generous helping of parmesan cheese. Being Italian, I feel parmesan cheese just adds flavor to everything! I like the potatoes on the crispier side too. I only use onion powder because I don't like onion. No one seems to notice the lack of onion but everyone compliments the frittata. It's good hot or cold and healthy too!
Turned out delicious!! My son loved it!!
Delicious!!
I added mushrooms, green peppers and salsa along with the recipe and it was delicious.
Good and filling everyone up for the mornings. Mine just didn't come out as a whole piece. Flavorfull and nutritious.

I followed the recipe and added a quarter diced tomato, however the bottom of the frittata got burnt in the skillet. What is the trick to not getting the bottom burnt? to not cover it? or to flip it halfway?

A winner! I made this for my book club and it was a hit. I reviewed the others' comments and made the following changes from the basic recipe:
3 B-sized red potatoes (instead of 6): they were seasoned w/garlic powder, salt, pepper and olive oil prior to cooking.
2+ cups chopped fresh spinach (instead of 1)
1/2 of a red bell pepper chopped and added w/the spinach and garlic.
Yellow onion instead of the green onion (because it's what I had on hand.)
3T fresh basil with the spinach +
1/4 c slivered fresh basil on the top of the frittata prior to baking.
I used a 'Mexican' blend shredded cheese (again because that's what I had on hand.)
I cooked the frittata stove top for 6m and then in a 350F oven for 10m.
Two thumbs up!
I made it as written. Didn't come out to well-make sure you really whisk the egg mixture. I think that's what messed me up!

Im only rating this four stars because I made adjustments and think it would have been bland otherwise. My son, who is often picky, and my husband, who eats anything, both liked it. I added a little chorizo sausage and mushroom to the mix, I used an italian cheese blend, and I added basil at the end. Definitely use the basil if you like it. I got that suggestion from a prior review.

I have made this a few times now and it turns out really good every time. Not sure if it is because I live at high altitude or what but I do have to finish this in the oven, 10 minutes or so at 350 degrees and it is perfectly fluffy and delicious...I know it is done when the center has risen and the edges have pulled away from the side of the pan. It is really easy to modify this recipe and add whatever veggies or cheese you have handy.

It was good. I added spices and flavored olive oil. I regret not cutting slices in half but the men liked it. They added additional seasonings like sriracha and salsa...even canned chicken which I meant to add.

Too many potatoes and not enough spinach or cheese! It was not at all bad. 

Less potatoes, more cheddar, more spinach!

This easily made it's way to being a staple dish in our home. We added in chopped mushrooms and also seasoned the potatoes prior to adding the spinach mixture. It's been said countless times before but I have to repeat that the possibilities are endless using this a simple base.
I used almond milk instead of regular milk, chives instead of green onions, and garlic powder instead of garlic cloves. I also added paprika and Italian seasoning. It's very yummy!

I pretty much followed the recipe other than adding some seasoning to the potatoes while they cooked (as suggested by other reviewers). I needed to finish the dish off in the oven as I had a hard time getting the top center of the eggs done. It was pretty good, but I was not 'overwhelmed'. Still ended up more bland than I was expecting. Maybe next time more garlic and onion, or maybe use leeks instead of the green onion.

First time followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious. Second time I increased the spinach slightly and added halved grape tomatoes flat against the pan, prior to pouring egg mixture, to add a little color and interest. I am not an accomplished cook, but this has worked perfectly twice. 
Great recipe.
Salt and pepper the potatoe slices before adding the other ingredients.
I increased the proportions and put it in a 10" skillet - took forever to set. Next time I will probably put it in a medium casserole dish and bake it.
My go to veggie dish for my daughter. She loves it.
This is a great and easy recipe, we like it a lot!

Added onions and garlic to potatoes earlier to flavor them. Used a lot more spinach and parmesan instead of cheddar; no milk. This tasted good but did not set up until I put it in the oven to bake for 400 at 5 minutes after cooking on stovetop. This is an important change to cooking method but was tasty.

So easy and quick to make. My changes were to add three times the spinach, use different cheese (because we can!) and cut out the milk (useless for this recipe). My kids loved it. There were no leftovers and many requests to make it again. We served it as a side dish, but it could easily have been the main dish. This is such a great basic recipe as is, but you can make it personal with just a few additions. Bacon, ham, fresh herbs, tomatoes and mushrooms are just a few things I'd like to try (a few at a time of course). Thanks for such a super fun recipe!

I like the dish and rated 5 stars, but I would correct the recipe a little bit. Next time I wouldn't hesitate to double the spinach. And also I think it wouldn't hurt to season potatoes with Italian spices mix.

I made this this morning for my boyfriend and myself, it was so good!! I seasoned the potatoes with garlic salt and pepper and holy moly did they taste good! I also added manchego cheese along with the cheddar on top! Loved it! So fluffy and moist and yummy!

First time ever making a frittata, and I'm surprised how simple this is. This recipe seems very versatile, there are somethings I would change for my personal use but I love that I found this basic recipe!
We loved it! I used russett potatoes because its what I had. I put 1/3 cup of fresh chopped basil leaves and some sliced grape tomatoes. yummy.

It's such a great recipe. I did season the potatoes with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, cayenne & lots of s&p. (Saw someone else did this). I have added sliced tomato on top & made it without milk & cheese. All versions tasted good :)
I added cuajada cheese crumbles, fresh basil and cut the cheddar cheese down to 1/2 cup.
I thought this was pretty bland as it was. I used all ingredients from scratch. Some of the suggestions in the reviews would have made this really great with spices on the potatoes..
This was good. I added sliced cherry tomatoes and a little extra cheese. I also had to cook it almost double the amount suggested, but it was tasty!
Used zucchini and green beans instead of spinach as I didn't have any and 4 eggs (as I don't like things too egg-y). Hubby loved it and I liked it, but it definitely needed more spice.

Like several other reviewers said, this recipe is very versatile and easy to work with. I halved the recipe since it was for just two people and I added mushrooms and I used mozzarella cheese. I had a hard time getting the potatoes to become soft enough in my frying pan so I think I may microwave them or boil them for about 10 minutes next time but there will definitely be a next time! This is relatively healthy, cheap and delicious, a perfect combination.

I am going thru a phase these days with an aversion to potatos so I used white rice instead. I also did not have spinach on hand but tomatos and green pepper and some cooked chicken. I made a two serving dish which came out very nice. Thx fir sharing it.

I don't normally like frittatas, but my boyfriend and I are trying to find more ways to get healthy protein in our breakfasts, so I thought I'd give this a shot. All the ingredients are things I love, and this worked perfectly. Tasty and fluffy. Big win!

Okay im not a big breakfast type person but my mother is so.... Every sunday I go to my mothers to have coffee with her, its a great time, you know the things that make lasting memories. well I surprised her and made this dish OMG I even loved it!!!! My mother was so impressed I cant thankyou enough for the recipe. To see her smile and enjoy time with her son and the food he cooked for her is priceless !!!!!

Used red onions chopped. This recipe does need some pizzaz so I used lots of black and red paprika with italian seasoning on the chopped potatoes. Spring onions is a better choice, but i had only red onions. I used Mexican cheese mix and still tasted yum!
I'm not sure what I may have did wrong but it did not set up right. It was still very tasty.
Tastes great as a base recipe but definitely needs a flavor boost, I added some basil and some various other spices.

The recipe turned out delicious. I eliminated the potatoes, used frozen spinach and added mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, yellow onions and a few slices of red bell pepper. I will definitely add to my book of favorite recipes.
Tried this one without chedder cheese. Nice taste.
Great recipe you can change up a million ways. I didn't have milk, so I used Greek yogurt. You can spice up and add veggies to your taste!

I had never made a frittata before. I tried scaling the recipe down to 4 servings, and put it in a smaller pan. However, there was still a lot of filling, so it took twice as long to cook because it was too deep in the pan, and meanwhile the bottom burned. Next time I will use the larger pan even with fewer portions.
I also used a reviewer's suggestion of seasoning the potatoes, but then forgot to add salt later on, so the rest of the frittata needed salt after I had served it. Overall though, the hubby requested I make it again, just without the burnt "crust" on the bottom. :)

Really good! I added Italian seasoning, garlic powder & a little cayenne to the potatoes. I also placed some sliced tomatoes on top before adding the cheese. I had to finish it in the oven as the top wasn't setting. Make it :)

This was a very good recipe. I doubled it, diced the potatoes and added more cheese. It tasted as good as it smelled. I like the suggestions from others and will try some next time. (I forgot to take a pic before I had cut it).

I cooked my potatoes til golden and done in coconut oil seasoned with smoked paprika, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powders. I used collard greens because I'd gotten some from the CSA today and couldn't figure out what to use them for. I can imagine that this would have been very bland if I hadn't seasoned the potatoes first, but it's so versatile that I gave it four stars. I'd never made a frittata before; quiche, yes.
So happy to find a recipe for a frittata that I had the ingredients on hand. I could also add to it and it still was very good!

This was just ok. My stove must run high. After a couple mins on medium heat some of my potatoes were burnt, so I had to turn it to a medium low. As others stated, this will not be done in 5-7 mins, especially not on low. I had turned the oven to 350 to preheat, and the eggs were not done by that time. I put the skillet into the oven and baked it for about 18 mins, perfect. Not sure if I would make this one in particular again, but it is a good starting base.

I made this for Mother's Day. My mom said that she liked it ( I didn't try it, I don't like eggs ) the reason why I gave it a four star rating was because the eggs did not cook in 5 to 7 minutes, it took about 20! I think the only reason that the potatoes were not raw was because of the time it took to cook the eggs. By the time it was done my mom was already up, so it could not be a suprise breakfast like I had planned. I will only make this again if my mom BEGS me to.

I cut the potatoes into a large dice and used twice as much fresh spinach as the recipe calls for. There are so many things you can do to make this a different dish each time. Ham would be phenomenal as would tomatoes. I finished the frittata in a 350 degree oven. It took about six or seven minutes and it was perfect! Reheated the next day it was still delicious so this would be a perfect recipe to make on the weekend and heat up for busy weekday mornings.

This is a great, versatile recipe. You can use any of your favorite veggies and cheeses. The only thing I did differently was to throw it in the oven to finish up cooking the egg mixture and brown the top slightly.
I can eat this daily! Yummy!!
I thought that it was very easy to make. I will make it again for Sunday brunch.

I made the frittata today for a friend and it was wonderful. I made a couple of small changes. I cooked four strips of center cut bacon and used the bacon grease and a small amount of olive oil to cook the potatoes. I added the bacon to the dish and stired it in before sprinkling the dish with cheese.

Great recipe base. I made it as written today. It was very good. I will definitely be making this again but I think next time I'll add a cup of broccoli, skip the cheese, decrease the potato, decrease the oil (just my own personal preference). This was my first frittata and definitely not my last. Thanks for teaching me how to make it!
I've made this a few times now, always to great reviews. I recommend trying it with jalapeno cheese as opposed to regular cheddar, and mushrooms mixed in.
Delicious! I added some Lawry salt when cooking the potatoes and omitted the salt and pepper. It took a little longer to cook than the recipes states, but it was really delicious.
LOVED THIS RECIPE i used frozen spinach the only thing missing was a salsa

This had an interesting taste. Probably won't make it again, but if I do, I think I would mix the spinach, green onions and garlic together and pour it over the potatoes instead of mixing it all together. The potatoes would make an excellent "crust" for the bottom. Thank you for sharing the recipe!
